meanings.definition: To cook sugar until it becomes caramel.
meanings.sent1: She caramelises the sugar for the dessert.
meanings.sent2: The chef caramelises the sugar to make a sweet sauce.
meanings.sent3: The sugar caramelises in the pan, turning golden and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The heat caramelises the sugar, transforming it into a rich syrup.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of caramelising sugar fills the kitchen with sweetness.

meanings.definition: To make or become caramel in color or flavor.
meanings.sent1: The sauce caramelises beautifully, adding a rich flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the sugar caramelises, giving the dessert a deep, sweet taste.
meanings.sent3: The caramelising color of the sauce makes it look like liquid gold.
meanings.sent4: The flavors caramelise together, creating a delicious harmony.
meanings.sent5: The dish caramelises slowly, intensifying its caramel-like essence.
